info.description:
Expedia Mobile API Documentation.
(Note: In case of authorization exception, just Sign-In)
info.title: Flights, Hotels, LX, Cars, Rails, Packages, Trips, User API

parameters.name: departureDate
parameters.description: Date the customer wants to leave for their flight on, in ISO format.

parameters.name: returnDate
parameters.description: Date the customer wants to return on. If present indicates a round trip search. If not supplied, then it's a one-way search.

parameters.name: departureAirport
parameters.description: The three letter airport code for where the customer is leaving from.

parameters.name: arrivalAirport
parameters.description: The three letter airport code to where the customer is going.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.description: Controls JSON response formatting. When set to true, its human-readable.

parameters.name: numberOfAdultTravelers
parameters.description: Number of Adult Travelers (Default: 1)

parameters.name: childTravelerAge
parameters.description: childTravelerAge represents the age of a single child traveler. You are required to specify the age of all child travelers. That means you must specify this parameter for each child that will be flying. Valid values are 0-17 (0 for an infant under the age of one year).

parameters.name: infantSeatingInLap
parameters.description: Set to true if infant(s) are without a reserved seat (in an adult's lap).(Default: false - Infant(s) in a reserved seat)

parameters.name: lccAndMerchantFareCheckoutAllowed
parameters.description: flag to indicate whether lcc and merchant fares should be returned in search response

parameters.name: correlationId
parameters.description: Optional parameter to define a correlation between a hotel search and a flight search

parameters.name: maxOfferCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of offers to return. (Default: 111, Max: 2000)

parameters.name: showRefundableFlight
parameters.description: Set to true to return only refundable(Free cancellation available) flights in the search response .(Default:False)

parameters.name: nonStopFlight
parameters.description: Set to true to return only non stop flights in the search response .(Default:False)

post.description: Mobile API Flights Create Trip Operation

parameters.name: productKey
parameters.description: The product key, obtained from /api/flight/search, we are going to create a trip for. The productKey or mobileShoppingKey is required.

parameters.name: mobileShoppingKey
parameters.description: The mobile shopping key we are going to create a trip for. The productKey or mobileShoppingKey is required.

parameters.name: tripTitle
parameters.description: The name of this itinerary as it will appear to customer service and in the itinerary list. Upto 255 characters that must be one of these: .,a-zA-Z0-9'- #

parameters.name: withInsurance
parameters.description: Whether to return the available insurance options for this trip. Currently this only works for flights. (Default: false)

parameters.name: qualifyAirAttach
parameters.description: Whether to return a qualified air attach product for this trip. It will use the same rate plan and room type codes as the productKey sent in the request. But the product key that will be used to get the air attached product will be different.

post.summary: Get the credit card fee for a trip
post.description: This api provides an accurate credit card fee that a user would have to pay when booking a trip.

parameters.name: tripId
parameters.description: The id of the trip to get the credit card fee for.

parameters.name: creditCardId
parameters.description: This is a string that identifies the credit card that will be used to pay for the trip. It can be either the first 6 digits of a credit card number, called the bin prefix. Or it can be the paymentsInstrumentsId of a stored credit card in a user's account. The paymentsInstrumentsId can be found in the list of storedCreditCards from the sign-in response.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: Client Id

parameters.name: departureDate
parameters.description: Date the customer wants to leave for their flight on, in ISO format.

parameters.name: returnDate
parameters.description: Date the customer wants to return on. If present indicates a round trip search. If not supplied, then it's a one-way search.

parameters.name: productKey
parameters.description: A productKey, obtained from a call to flight search, within the past 20 minutes. Required. If the price has changed since the key was issued, a price change error will be thrown (eventually; not implemented yet). If the key has expired, this will (eventually, not implemented yet) return product key expired.

parameters.name: departureAirport
parameters.description: The three letter airport code for where the customer is leaving from.

parameters.name: arrivalAirport
parameters.description: The three letter airport code for where the customer is going.

parameters.name: numberOfAdultTravelers
parameters.description: Number of Adult Travelers (Default: 1)

parameters.name: childTravelerAge
parameters.description: childTravelerAge represents the age of a single child traveler. You are required to specify the age of all child travelers. That means you must specify this parameter for each child that will be flying. Valid values are 0-17 (0 for an infant under the age of one year).

parameters.name: infantSeatingInLap
parameters.description: Set to true if infant(s) are without a reserved seat (in an adult's lap).(Default: false - Infant(s) in a reserved seat)

parameters.name: destinationCode
parameters.description: The three letter airport code or metro code of the destination.

parameters.name: imageWidth
parameters.description: Requested width of the image.

parameters.name: imageHeight
parameters.description: Requested height of the image.

get.description: Mobile API Flight Mobile Image Operation

parameters.name: imageCode
parameters.description: image primary key, for example CAR:ECONOMY ACTIVITY:DISNEY DESTINATION:JFK DESTINATIONMOBILEWEB:JFK CARMOBILEWEB:MINI

parameters.name: imageType
parameters.description: type of image. examples DESTINATION DESTINATIONMOBILEWEB CAR CARMOBILEWEB ACTIVITY

parameters.name: imageWidth
parameters.description: Requested width of the image.

parameters.name: imageHeight
parameters.description: Requested height of the image.

get.description: Mobile API Flight Airport Dropdown Operation

post.description: Checkout a previously created flight trip, requiring payment fields, the trip id, and the passenger fields

parameters.name: tripId
parameters.description: The trip ID of an existing trip, from /api/flight/trip/create.

parameters.name: expectedTotalFare
parameters.description: The expected total price of the trip, matching exactly whatever the user last saw. No leading zeros, no thousands separators, and 2 decimal places of precision. This is obtained from /api/flight/trip/create.

parameters.name: expectedFareCurrencyCode
parameters.description: Three letter 4217 ISO currency code of the expected total price. This should be whatever was returned by the server. Conversions will not be done. This is obtained from /api/flight/trip/create.

parameters.name: expectedCardFee
parameters.description: The expected credit card fee, as returned by the createTrip call in the validFormsOfPayment object for whatever credit card the user is paying with. No leading zeros, no thousands separators, and 2 decimal places of precision.

parameters.name: expectedCardFeeCurrencyCode
parameters.description: Three letter 4217 ISO currency code of the expected credit card fee. This should be whatever was returned by the server. Conversions will not be done.

parameters.name: doIThinkImSignedIn
parameters.description: As a client I am checking-out with the assumption that I am signed in

parameters.name: tealeafTransactionId
parameters.description: The unique transaction ID used in TeaLeaf PSR tracking

parameters.name: omniturePartnerId
parameters.description: Omniture partner identification string

parameters.name: sendEmailConfirmation
parameters.description: Used to check if confirmation email needs to be sent or not.

parameters.name: mainFlightPassenger[0].phoneCountryCode
parameters.description: Country code of the phone of the main flight passenger

parameters.name: mainFlightPassenger[0].phone
parameters.description: Phone number of the main flight passenger

parameters.name: mainFlightPassenger[0].email
parameters.description: Email address of the main flight passenger

parameters.name: mainFlightPassenger[0].password
parameters.description: Password of the main flight passenger

parameters.name: mainFlightPassenger[0].expediaEmailOptIn
parameters.description: If the main flight passenger wishes to opt out for Expedia emails or not

parameters.name: associatedFlightPassengers[0].title
parameters.description: Title of the associated flight passenger fields.

parameters.name: associatedFlightPassengers[0].gender
parameters.description: Gender of the associated flight passenger fields.

parameters.name: associatedFlightPassengers[0].birthDate
parameters.description: Birth date of the associated flight passenger fields.

parameters.name: associatedFlightPassengers[0].seatPreference
parameters.description: Seat preference of the associated flight passenger fields.

parameters.name: associatedFlightPassengers[0].passengerCategory
parameters.description: :Passenger category of the associated flight passenger fields.

parameters.name: associatedFlightPassengers[0].passportCountryCode
parameters.description: Passport country code of the associated flight passenger fields.

parameters.name: associatedFlightPassengers[0].TSARedressNumber
parameters.description: TSA redress number of the associated flight passenger fields.

parameters.name: associatedFlightPassengers[0].knownTravelerNumber
parameters.description: knownTravelerNumber(PreCheckNumber) of the associated flight passenger fields.

parameters.name: associatedFlightPassengers[0].specialAssistanceOption
parameters.description: Special assistance option for the associated flight passenger fields.

parameters.name: validateWithChildren
parameters.description: Set this flag to true to enable child validation logic on the server. If you wish to book with child passengers then you must set this flag to true. (default: false)

parameters.name: phoneCountryCode
parameters.description: Country code of the phone of the main flight passenger

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Phone number of the main flight passenger

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email address of the main flight passenger

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Password of the main flight passenger

parameters.name: expediaEmailOptIn
parameters.description: If the main flight passenger wishes to opt out for Expedia emails or not

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Title of the associated flight passenger fields.

parameters.name: gender
parameters.description: Gender of the associated flight passenger fields.

parameters.name: birthDate
parameters.description: Birth date of the associated flight passenger fields.

parameters.name: seatPreference
parameters.description: Seat preference of the associated flight passenger fields.

parameters.name: passengerCategory
parameters.description: :Passenger category of the associated flight passenger fields.

parameters.name: passportCountryCode
parameters.description: Passport country code of the associated flight passenger fields.

parameters.name: TSARedressNumber
parameters.description: TSA redress number of the associated flight passenger fields.

parameters.name: knownTravelerNumber
parameters.description: knownTravelerNumber(PreCheckNumber) of the associated flight passenger fields.

parameters.name: specialAssistanceOption
parameters.description: Special assistance option for the associated flight passenger fields.

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: The first name of the traveler

parameters.name: middleName
parameters.description: The middle name of the traveler.

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: The last name of the traveler.

parameters.name: streetAddress
parameters.description: The street part of the credit card owner's billing address..

parameters.name: streetAddress2
parameters.description: Apartment or suite number of the traveler's billing address.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The city of the traveler's billing address.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The state (or province) of the traveler's billing address.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The 3 letter country code of the traveler's billing address.

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: The postal code of the traveler's billing address. Required only postalCode only checkout.

parameters.name: creditCardNumber
parameters.description: The credit card number used for this booking, if checking out with a new card. This field is required for guest checkout.

parameters.name: expirationDateYear
parameters.description: The 4 digit expiration date year of the credit card used for this booking. This field is required for guest checkout.

parameters.name: expirationDateMonth
parameters.description: The expiration date month of the credit card used for this booking. This field is required guest for checkout.

parameters.name: cvv
parameters.description: The CVV of the traveler's credit card used for this booking.

parameters.name: storedCreditCardId
parameters.description: The GUID for the stored credit card information to be used for payment. The retrieved credit card information should trump the other credit card parameter in this request.

parameters.name: storeCreditCardInUserProfile
parameters.description: Indicates whether to save the credit card information as a stored credit card in the user profile. This is ignored if the user is not signed in.

parameters.name: nameOnCard
parameters.description: The card holder's name

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.description: If true, return JSON with tabs, spaces and newlines to be human readable

parameters.name: suppressFinalBooking
parameters.description: If true, do not actually charge for and book the trip, stop after creating the itinerary. Used for testing on the checkout call only. Checkout will return 00000 for the OMS order ID when this is true

post.description: Creates a flight trip, passing a product key and all required fields.

parameters.name: productKey
parameters.description: The product key we are going to create a trip for. The productKey or mobileShoppingKey is required.

parameters.name: numberOfAdultTravelers
parameters.description: Number of Adult Travelers (Default: 1).

parameters.name: childTravelerAge[0]
parameters.description: childTravelerAge represents the age of a single child traveler. You are required to specify the age of all child travelers. That means you must specify this parameter for each child that will be flying. Valid values are 0-17 (0 for an infant under the age of one year). If you would like to specify 3 child travelers with the ages of 1, 3 and 8 years, then your query string should contain:childTravelerAge=1&childTravelerAge=3&childTravelerAge=8

parameters.name: infantSeatingInLap
parameters.description: Set to true if infant(s) are without a reserved seat (in an adult's lap).(Default: false - Infant(s) in a reserved seat)

parameters.name: tripTitle
parameters.description: The name of this itinerary as it will appear to customer service and in the itinerary list. Upto 255 characters that must be one of these: .,a-zA-Z0-9'- #

parameters.name: withInsurance
parameters.description: Whether to return the available insurance options for this trip. Currently this only works for flights. (Default: false)

get.description:
Mobile API Hotels Search

There are multiple successful responses for this operation.
See the examples below for more information.

parameters.name: tripId
parameters.description: This field is optional and will default to the the POS default PriceType.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: A string to identify the city to search.

parameters.name: regionId
parameters.description: An Expedia region ID to limit the search to a particular region.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description: Latitude to be used in combination with longitude for a coordinate search.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description: Longitude to be used in combination with latitude for a coordinate search.

parameters.name: correlationId
parameters.description: Define a correlation between a hotel search and a flight search.

parameters.name: filterUnavailable
parameters.description: Unavailable hotels will be removed from the response if set to true. The default is false if not specified.

parameters.name: filterHotelName
parameters.description: Hotel name used to filter the search results.

parameters.name: filterInventoryType
parameters.description: A parameter to filter by inventory type. Only supports MERCHANT right now, all other values are just ignored.

parameters.name: filterPrice
parameters.description: Used to filter by price, make sure it matches filterPriceBuckets if counts are desired. Must contain 1 or 2 numbers. 1 number means there is no max price, min price must be greater than or equal to 0.

parameters.name: filterPriceBuckets
parameters.description: Used to define custom price filter buckets. if not provided then the default price filter buckets for the POS will be used. No need to define 0, each value in price bucket is minimum of price range. Note that price range can be decimal format but buckets must be integer. If supplied 4 values are required as input.

parameters.name: filterStarRatings
parameters.description: Used to filter by star rating. Must be in increments of 5 and separated by commas(minStarRating=0 and maxStarRating=50). Ex. '0,5,10' means 0, 0.5 and 1 star hotels

parameters.name: filterAmenities
parameters.description: Used to filter by amenities. Must be as a list of amenity ids separated by commas. Please note that there is no way at this time to validate the ids are actually valid.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Order to sort the list of hotels by Expedia picks, star rating, price and guest rating.

parameters.name: sortOrderFilter
parameters.description: A post process sort order filter used to apply post sort order filtering to the sorted (sortOrder) search results.

parameters.name: resultsPerPage
parameters.description: The number of hotels to return per page. A value of -1 (negative one) is reserved to mean Return ALL matching hotels. The default value is 25 (twenty five).

parameters.name: pageIndex
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the page that you are requesting. The default value is 0 (zero).

parameters.name: forceV2Search
parameters.description: A flag to indicate whether the api should do a domain V2 search for the mobile app.

parameters.name: returnOpaqueHotels
parameters.description: Return Opaque hotels if set to true.

parameters.name: hgid
parameters.description: If the hotel group ID parameter (hgid) is present it will take precedence over city, location or lat/long

parameters.name: airAttachQualificationCode
parameters.description: Qualification code needed to get air attached hotel prices

parameters.name: enableSponsoredListings
parameters.description: Used to check for sponsoredListing. By default the value would be false

parameters.name: sourceType
parameters.description: Source type for the request

parameters.name: checkInDate
parameters.description: Check in date in ISO format (yyyy-MM-dd)

parameters.name: checkOutDate
parameters.description: Check out date in ISO format (yyyy-MM-dd)

parameters.name: room1
parameters.description: [Optional if room field is specified] A Comma Separated Value of #OfAdults, followed by children's ages for all children that are 18 and under. If the child is under 1 then specify as 0. For example 2,12,2,3,0. If it's just adults an example would be 2.

parameters.name: room
parameters.description: [Optional if room1 field is specified] A Comma Separated Value of #OfAdults, followed by children's ages for all children that are 18 and under. If the child is under 1 then specify as 0. For example 2,12,2,3,0. If it's just adults an example would be 2.

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: a 32-bit integer, currently between 1 through 7 digit number

parameters.name: priceType
parameters.description: Price Type, can only be TOTAL_PRICE or BASE_PRICE_ONLY

parameters.name: useCacheForAirAttach
parameters.description: [Optional] If this flag is set then the hotel offers (on a successful offers call) and the search fields will be cached. There is a possiblilty that theywill be used later in the create trip calls

parameters.name: sourceType
parameters.description: Source Type, for example mobilweb or mobileapp

parameters.name: checkInDate
parameters.description: Checkin Date

parameters.name: checkOutDate
parameters.description: Checkout Date

parameters.name: room1
parameters.description: [Optional if room field is specified] A Comma Separated Value of #OfAdults, followed by children's ages for all children that are 18 and under. If the child is under 1 then specify as 0. For example 2,12,2,3,0. If it's just adults an example would be 2.

parameters.name: room
parameters.description: [Optional if room1 field is specified] A Comma Separated Value of #OfAdults, followed by children's ages for all children that are 18 and under. If the child is under 1 then specify as 0. For example 2,12,2,3,0. If it's just adults an example would be 2.

parameters.name: productKey
parameters.description: The product key, obtained by calling /m/api/hotel/offers,  we are going to create a trip for.

parameters.name: tripTitle
parameters.description: [Optional] The name of this itinerary as it will appear to customer service and in the itinerary list. Upto 255 characters that must be one of these: .,a-zA-Z0-9'- #

parameters.name: withInsurance
parameters.description: [Optional] Whether to return the available insurance options for this trip. Currently this only works for flights. (Default: false)

parameters.name: qualifyAirAttach
parameters.description: [Optional] Whether to return a qualified air attach product for this trip. It will use the same rate plan and room type codes as the productKey sent in the request. But the product key that will be used to get the air attached product will be different

parameters.name: roomInfoFields[0].room
parameters.description: A Comma Separated Value of #OfAdults, followed by children's ages for all children that are 18 and under. If the child is under 1 then specify as 0. For example 2,12,2,3,0. If it's just adults an example would be 2.

parameters.name: tripId
parameters.description: The trip ID of an existing trip, from /m/api/hotel/trip/create.

parameters.name: checkInDate
parameters.description: Check in date in ISO format (yyyy-MM-dd)

parameters.name: checkOutDate
parameters.description: Check out date in ISO format (yyyy-MM-DD)

parameters.name: rooms
parameters.description: A list of room preferences to be applied to the rooms being booked.

parameters.name: sendEmailConfirmation
parameters.description: Used to check if confirmation email needs to be sent or not.

parameters.name: bedTypeId
parameters.description: Parameter that indicates the selected bed Type. Defaults to the first available bed type of the hotel offer. [Deprecated]. Pass bedTypeId for each room.

parameters.name: phoneCountryCode
parameters.description: The country code of the phone number of the traveler. Only the numeric values in this field are used. +44 results in 44

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: The phone number of the traveler. Only the numeric values in this field are used.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: This passenger's email address. Required, although ignored for logged in users, as it will use their email on file instead.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password provided by the expedia user. This would imply that a user needs to be created with the above email id and this password. To be done only if this is a guest request.

parameters.name: expediaEmailOptIn
parameters.description: Whether to opt-in the user's email to travel deals

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: The first name of the traveler

parameters.name: middleName
parameters.description: The middle name of the traveler.

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: The last name of the traveler.

parameters.name: expectedTotalFare
parameters.description: The expected total price of the trip, matching exactly whatever the user last saw. No leading zeros, no thousands separators, and 2 decimal places of precision. This is obtained from /m/api/hotel/trip/create.

parameters.name: expectedFareCurrencyCode
parameters.description: Three letter 4217 ISO currency code of the expected credit card fee. This should be whatever was returned by the server. Conversions will not be done.This is obtained from /m/api/hotel/trip/create.

parameters.name: expectedCardFee
parameters.description: The expected credit card fee, as returned by the createTrip call in the validFormsOfPayment object for whatever credit card the user is paying with. No leading zeros, no thousands separators, and 2 decimal places of precision.

parameters.name: expectedCardFeeCurrencyCode
parameters.description: Three letter 4217 ISO currency code of the expected total price. This should be whatever was returned by the server. Conversions will not be done.

parameters.name: doIThinkImSignedIn
parameters.description: As a client I am checking-out with the assumption that I am signed in

parameters.name: tealeafTransactionId
parameters.description: The unique transaction ID used in TeaLeaf PSR tracking

parameters.name: omniturePartnerId
parameters.description: Omniture partner identification string

parameters.name: streetAddress
parameters.description: The street part of the credit card owner's billing address.

parameters.name: streetAddress2
parameters.description: Apartment or suite number of the traveler's billing address.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The city of the traveler's billing address.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The state (or province) of the traveler's billing address.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The 3 letter country code of the traveler's billing address.

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: The postal code of the traveler's billing address. Required only postalCode only checkout.

parameters.name: creditCardNumber
parameters.description: The credit card number used for this booking, if checking out with a new card. This field is required for guest checkout.

parameters.name: expirationDateYear
parameters.description: The 4 digit expiration date year of the credit card used for this booking. This field is required for guest checkout.

parameters.name: expirationDateMonth
parameters.description: The expiration date month of the credit card used for this booking. This field is required guest for checkout.

parameters.name: cvv
parameters.description: The CVV of the traveler's credit card used for this booking.

parameters.name: storedCreditCardId
parameters.description: The GUID for the stored credit card information to be used for payment. The retrieved credit card information should trump the other credit card parameter in this request.

parameters.name: storeCreditCardInUserProfile
parameters.description: Indicates whether to save the credit card information as a stored credit card in the user profile. This is ignored if the user is not signed in.

parameters.name: nameOnCard
parameters.description: The card holder's name

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.description: If true, return JSON with tabs, spaces and newlines to be human readable

parameters.name: suppressFinalBooking
parameters.description: If true, do not actually charge for and book the trip, stop after creating the itinerary. Used for testing on the checkout call only. Checkout will return 00000 for the OMS order ID when this is true

post.summary: Hotel Checkout With JSON Request Body

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON body with all the fields required for a Hotel checkout

get.description: Service that returns the fields that are required or optional for a given point of sale.
Cancel Enquiry for hotel, pass in itinerary id, email address of trip owner.

parameters.name: itineraryId
parameters.description: Itinerary containing trip to cancel. It is obtained by calling /m/api/hotel/trip/checkout.

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: Email address of the traveler.

get.description: Cancel Enquiry for hotel, pass in itinerary id, email address of trip owner.

parameters.name: orderLineGUIDs
parameters.description: Comma separated order line guids. If provided only details regarding the provided guids are returned.

parameters.name: itineraryId
parameters.description: Itinerary containing trip to cancel. It is obtained by calling /m/api/hotel/trip/checkout

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: Email address of the traveler.

parameters.name: sourceType
parameters.description: Source type for the request. mobileapp OR mobileweb. Leave blank for others.

parameters.name: productKey
parameters.description: The product key of the offer, obtained by calling /m/api/hotel/offers

parameters.name: roomOccupants[0].numberOfAdultGuests
parameters.description: Number of adults staying in this room (default: 1)

parameters.name: roomOccupants[0].childGuestAge
parameters.description: represents the age of a single child guest staying in this room. You should specify the age of all children staying in this room. Valid values are 0-17 (0 for an infant under the age of one year). For a single room with 1 adult and 3 child guests the ages of 1, 3 and 8 years

parameters.name: opaqueProduct
parameters.description: Set to true if the product key is an opaque hotel product key.

parameters.name: hotelId
parameters.description: Hotel Id usually 5 digits. It is obtained by calling /m/api/hotel/search

parameters.name: itineraryId
parameters.description: Itinerary id of the trip to cancel. It is obtained by calling /m/api/hotel/trip/checkout

parameters.name: emailAddress
parameters.description: Email address of the traveler.

parameters.name: sendConfirmationEmail
parameters.description: Email the traveler after cancellation or not.

parameters.name: orderLineGUIDs
parameters.description: The list of order line guids. Each corresponding to a room number

parameters.name: orderNumber
parameters.description: The order number ( returned by OMS ) associated with the trip

parameters.name: tripId
parameters.description: The trip ID ( returned while checkout ) associated with the trip. [ Note: Confirmation mail is sent only if this field is provided with valid tripId. ]

post.description:
Converts from a given currency amount to the equivalent in rewards points.
[Note: Works only if the User is signed-in and is the owner of the trip.]

parameters.name: tripId
parameters.description: The trip ID of an existing trip, from /api/packages/createTrip.

parameters.name: programName
parameters.description: The Rewards program name.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: The amount the user would want to convert to points. No leading zeros, no thousands separators, and 2 decimal places of precision.

parameters.name: rateId
parameters.description: The rate id to use for this conversion.

get.description: Gets packages and supports changed flights and hotels for flexible shopping.

parameters.name: packageType
parameters.description: Supports different views of F+H package.

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: The user's search string.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The users's search string

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: The date the customer wants to leave the origin. If not specified, we will make up some dates to support the "dateless" scenario. If specified, then toDate must also be specified.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: The date the customer wants to leave the destination. Specified in either ISO format of the locale format for the POS.

parameters.name: numberOfRooms
parameters.description: How many hotel rooms you want. If not specified, will default to 1 room with 2 adults. Required if you want anything else.

parameters.name: adultsPerRoom[1]
parameters.description: How many adults will stay in the given room. Room numbers are 1-based. Specify separately for every room requested. Each room requires at least 1 adult or senior. Max total travelers across all rooms: 6

parameters.name: originId
parameters.description: Region ID of the origin or destination. For the destination, it's used to decide which hotels to show.

parameters.name: destinationId
parameters.description: Region ID of the origin or destination. For the destination, it's used to decide which hotels to show.

parameters.name: ftla
parameters.description: TLA (airport code or metrocode) for the origin (ftla) or destination (ttla). Used to disambiguate which airport to use for the region IDs provided above. If the provided TLAs are not returned by ESS for the region IDs above, they are ignored.

parameters.name: ttla
parameters.description: TLA (airport code or metrocode) for the origin (ftla) or destination (ttla). Used to disambiguate which airport to use for the region IDs provided above. If the provided TLAs are not returned by ESS for the region IDs above, they are ignored.

parameters.name: packagePIID
parameters.description: Taken from a previous package response.

parameters.name: pageType
parameters.description: Only for change hotel

parameters.name: searchProduct
parameters.description: i.e. flight

parameters.name: packageTripType
parameters.description: i.e. 0: Complete Round Trip 1: Best Trip 2: BYOT

parameters.name: productKey
parameters.description: The product ID (piid) of the package you would like to get hotel offers for.

parameters.name: checkInDate
parameters.description: Date the traveler will be checking in to their hotel

parameters.name: checkOutDate
parameters.description: Date the traveler will be checking out of their hotel

parameters.name: numberOfAdultTravelers
parameters.description: Number of Adult Travelers (Default: 1)

parameters.name: childTravelerAge
parameters.description: childTravelerAge represents the age of a single child traveler. You are required to specify the age of all child travelers. That means you must specify this parameter for each child that will be traveling. Valid values are 0-17 (0 for an infant under the age of one year).

parameters.name: infantSeatingInLap
parameters.description: Set to true if infant(s) are without a reserved seat (in an adult's lap).(Default: false - Infant(s) in a reserved seat)

parameters.name: roomTypeCode
parameters.description: Room Type Code of the selected hotel offer.

parameters.name: ratePlanCode
parameters.description: Rate Plan Code of the selected hotel offer.

parameters.name: roomOccupants[0].infantsInSeat

parameters.name: roomOccupants[0].childGuestAge
parameters.description: represents the age of a single child guest staying in this room. You should specify the age of all children staying in this room. Valid values are 0-17 (0 for an infant under the age of one year). For a single room with 1 adult and 3 child guests the ages of 1, 3 and 8 years

parameters.name: hotel[0].primaryContactFullName
parameters.description: Full name of the person who will be checking in. This person must be 21 or older.

parameters.name: hotel[0].bedTypeId
parameters.description: Indicates the selected bed Type. Defaults to the first available bed type of the hotel offer.

parameters.name: tripId
parameters.description: The trip ID of an existing trip, from /api/packages/createTrip.

parameters.name: expectedTotalFare
parameters.description: The expected total price of the trip, matching exactly whatever the user last saw. No leading zeros, no thousands separators, and 2 decimal places of precision. This is obtained from /api/packages/createTrip.

parameters.name: expectedFareCurrencyCode
parameters.description: Three letter 4217 ISO currency code of the expected credit card fee. This should be whatever was returned by the server. Conversions will not be done. This is obtained from /api/packages/createTrip.

parameters.name: expectedCardFee
parameters.description: The expected credit card fee, as returned by the createTrip call in the validFormsOfPayment object for whatever credit card the user is paying with. No leading zeros, no thousands separators, and 2 decimal places of precision.

parameters.name: expectedCardFeeCurrencyCode
parameters.description: Three letter 4217 ISO currency code of the expected total price. This should be whatever was returned by the server. Conversions will not be done.

parameters.name: sendEmailConfirmation
parameters.description: Used to check if confirmation email needs to be sent or not.

parameters.name: doIThinkImSignedIn
parameters.description: As a client I am checking-out with the assumption that I am signed in

parameters.name: tealeafTransactionId
parameters.description: The unique transaction ID used in TeaLeaf PSR tracking

parameters.name: omniturePartnerId
parameters.description: Omniture partner identification string

parameters.name: nameOnCard
parameters.description: The card holder's name

parameters.name: streetAddress
parameters.description: The street part of the credit card owner's billing address.

parameters.name: streetAddress2
parameters.description: Apartment or suite number of the traveler's billing address.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The city of the traveler's billing address.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The state (or province) of the traveler's billing address.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The 3 letter country code of the traveler's billing address.

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: The postal code of the traveler's billing address. Required only postalCode only checkout.

parameters.name: creditCardNumber
parameters.description: The credit card number used for this booking, if checking out with a new card. This field is required for guest checkout.

parameters.name: expirationDateYear
parameters.description: The 4 digit expiration date year of the credit card used for this booking. This field is required for guest checkout.

parameters.name: expirationDateMonth
parameters.description: The expiration date month of the credit card used for this booking. This field is required guest for checkout.

parameters.name: cvv
parameters.description: The CVV of the traveler's credit card used for this booking.

parameters.name: storedCreditCardId
parameters.description: The GUID for the stored credit card information to be used for payment. The retrieved credit card information should trump the other credit card parameter in this request.

parameters.name: storeCreditCardInUserProfile
parameters.description: Indicates whether to save the credit card information as a stored credit card in the user profile. This is ignored if the user is not signed in.

post.summary: Rails Checkout With JSON Request Body

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON body with all the fields required for a Rails checkout

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email Address. Used at the time of User creation in /api/user/create

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: User Password. Used at the time of User creation in /api/user/create

parameters.name: staySignedIn
parameters.description: Sign Me In checkbox

parameters.name: profileOnly
parameters.description: If true, don't provide username/password fields and just re-retrieve the currently signed on user's profile. If this is false or not provided, force re-authentication of the user.

parameters.name: itinNumber
parameters.description: The Itinerary Number can be used instead of a password to authenticate the user.

parameters.name: guestLoginWithItin
parameters.description: When logging in with an Itin Number and Email set this field to True. Default value is false.

parameters.name: profileTypes
parameters.description: This is a comma-separated list of profile types to retrieve when the login is processed. E.g., profileType=HOTEL,FLIGHT. Options are currently HOTEL, FLIGHT, or NONE. If NONE is the type, it should be the only one in the list.

parameters.name: retrieveCoupons
parameters.description: Whether to include user coupons in the response.

parameters.name: firstTimeSigin
parameters.description: Boolean to indicate if this is a first time sign-in.

parameters.name: tuid
parameters.description: The tuid of the user/account whose profile you would like.

parameters.name: profileTypes
parameters.description: This is a comma-separated list of profile types to retrieve when the login is processed. E.g., profileType=HOTEL,FLIGHT. Options are currently HOTEL or FLIGHT.

parameters.name: retrieveCoupons
parameters.description: Whether to include user coupons in the response.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Users email address

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Users password

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: Users first name

parameters.name: middleName
parameters.description: Users middle name

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: Users last name

parameters.name: expediaEmailOptIn
parameters.description: Whether to opt-in the user's email to travel deals

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Title of passenger

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: The first name of the traveler. 2 character min.

parameters.name: middleName
parameters.description: The middle name of the traveler.

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: The last name of the traveler.

parameters.name: phoneCountryCode
parameters.description: The country code of the phone number of the traveler. Only the numeric values in this field are used. E.g., +44 is treated internally as 44.

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: The phone number of the traveler. Only the numeric values in this field are used. E.g., 555-1234 is treated internally as 5551234.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: This passenger's email address. Required, although ignored for logged in users, as it will use their email on file instead.

parameters.name: gender
parameters.description: TSA required field, MALE or FEMALE.

parameters.name: birthDate
parameters.description: TSA required field; passenger's birth date.

parameters.name: seatPreference
parameters.description: Passenger's seat preference. Options are WINDOW, AISLE, or UNASSIGNED (default)

parameters.name: passengerCategory
parameters.description: The passenger's category. (Default ADULT)

parameters.name: passportCountryCode
parameters.description: Passport country, UPPERCASE three letter country code. Only required for international travel.

parameters.name: TSARedressNumber
parameters.description: Passenger's TSA redress number, which is, in theory a 7 digit number.

parameters.name: knownTravelerNumber
parameters.description: Passenger's knownTravelerNumber(PreCheckNumber), a 9 digit number.

parameters.name: specialAssistanceOption
parameters.description: Special assistance choice. This is one value, the same string returned from the profile call. Defaults to NONE if not provided.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password provided by the Expedia user. This would imply that a user needs to be created with the above email id and this password. To be done only if this is a guest request.

parameters.name: expediaEmailOptIn
parameters.description: Whether to opt-in the user's email to travel deals.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: (optional) dates in YYY-MM-DD format (preferred) or POS configuration format (e.g. MM/dd/yyyy for US) that you see in home page wizard. If not defined startDate default to today and endDate defaults to startDate + 14.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: (optional) dates in YYY-MM-DD format (preferred) or POS configuration format (e.g. MM/dd/yyyy for US) that you see in home page wizard. If not defined startDate default to today and endDate defaults to startDate + 14.

parameters.description: Use langid as defined for a POS secondary language

parameters.description: If true, do not actually charge for and book the trip, stop after creating the itinerary. Used for testing on the checkout call only. Checkout will return 00000 for the OMS order ID when this is true

errorCode.description: Possible error codes: INVALID_INPUT, HOTEL_ROOM_UNAVAILABLE, HOTEL_OFFER_UNAVAILABLE,HOTEL_SERVICE_FATAL_FAILURE, PAYMENT_FAILED, BOOKING_SUCCEEDED_WITH_ERRORS, BOOKING_FAILED, STORE_CREDIT_CARD_INFO_FAILED, SSL_REQUIRED,  USER_UNAUTHORIZED_FOR_PROFILE, UNKNOWN_ERROR, TRIP_SERVICE_ERROR, HOTEL_PRODUCT_NOT_FOUND, APPLY_COUPON_ERROR, REMOVE_COUPON_ERROR,APPLY_BACKICK_PRICE_ADJUSTMENT_ERROR,APPLY_ADJUSTMENT_UNAUTHORIZED,FLIGHT_SOLD_OUT, FLIGHT_PRODUCT_NOT_FOUND, USER_SERVICE_ERROR, USER_SERVICE_FATAL_FAILURE, USER_SERVICE_TRAVELER_ALREADY_EXISTS, SESSION_TIMEOUT, TRIP_ALREADY_BOOKED, USER_SERVICE_DUPLICATE_EMAIL, USER_SERVICE_CREATE_USER_ERROR, IMAGE_NOT_FOUND, CANNOT_BOOK_WITH_MINOR, USER_CREATION_FAILED_DURING_CHECKOUT, OMS_ERROR,INVALID_INPUT_NOT_OPAQUE_PRODUCT_KEY, PACKAGE_SEARCH_ERROR, CAR_PRODUCT_NOT_AVAILABLE, CAR_SERVICE_ERROR, CAR_SEARCH_ERROR

errorInfo.description: It returns a Map data structure

feeRange.description: Some credit card fees can have a range of amounts. For example 0 to $5. The exact fee can only be determined by the first 6 digits of a credit card's number.

min:.description: The minimum price that this fee could be

max:.description: The maximum price that this fee could be

description.description: S("Smoking", "label_smoking"), NS("Non-Smoking", "label_non_smoking"),E("Smoking or Non-Smoking", "label_smoking_or_non_smoking"), Unknown("Unknown smoking preference", "label_unknown_smoking_preference");

category.description: It can have following values: "* MINI", "* ECONOMY", "* COMPACT", "* MIDSIZE", "* STANDARD", "* FULLSIZE", "* PREMIUM", "* LUXURY", "* SPECIAL", "* MINI_ELITE", "* ECONOMY_ELITE", "* COMPACT_ELITE", "* MIDSIZE_ELITE", "* STANDARD_ELITE", "* FULLSIZE_ELITE", "* PREMIUM_ELITE", "* LUXURY_ELITE", "* OVERSIZE"

type.description: It can have following values: "* TWO_DOOR_CAR", "* THREE_DOOR_CAR", "* FOUR_DOOR_CAR", "* VAN", "* WAGON", "* LIMOUSINE", "* RECREATIONAL_VEHICLE", "* CONVERTIBLE", "* SPORTS_CAR", "* SUV", "* PICKUP_REGULAR_CAB", "* PICKUP_EXTENDED_CAB", "* OPEN_AIR_ALL_TERRAIN", "* SPECIAL", "* COMMERCIAL_VAN_TRUCK", "* SPECIAL_OFFER_CAR", "* COUPE", "* MONOSPACE", "* MOTORHOME", "* TWO_WHEEL_VEHICLE", "* ROADSTER", "* CROSSOVER"

carCategoryDisplayFullLabel.description: Display Car Full Label. eg - Compact 2/4Door Car

type.description: It can have the following values: "* `INSURANCE`","* `DROP_OFF_CHARGE`","* `TAXES_AND_FEES`","* `BASE`"

rateTerm.description: It can have the following values: HOURLY, DAILY, WEEKLY, WEEKEND, MONTHLY, TOTAL, TRIP

m_pointType.description: Possible description: basePoint, offerPoint, None, bonusPoint, fallOfferPoint, eliteCredit, manualAdjustment;

instances.description: Returns a Hashmap data structure(HashMap<String, Currency>)

inventoryType.description: Possible values: MERCHANT, PEGASUS, WORLDSPAN, VENERE, DIRECT_AGENCY, OPAQUE, ESCAPIA, WOTIF

type.description: Possible values: NONSTOP, DIRECT, ONESTOP, MULTISTOP

state.description: Possible values: PRE_START_4,PRE_START_3, PRE_START_2, PRE_START_1, PRE_START_0, POST_START, IN_PROGRESS, PRE_END, POST_END_0, POST_END_1, POST_END_2, POST_END_3

tripId.description: The trip id for the trip that this fee belongs to.

tripTotalPrice.description: The new trip total including the credit card fee
